definition: to waste (one's breath, one's energy etc)/to try in vain

sentences.english: He tried in vain to write down the movement.
sentences.chinese: 他枉費心機地寫文章詆譭這場運動。

sentences.english: I tried to attract her attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想引起他的注意，卻枉費心機。

sentences.english: But when the disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, Why this waster?
sentences.chinese: 門徒看見，就惱怒說，何必這樣枉費。

sentences.english: Ton Pak Fu, don't let us down.
sentences.chinese: 唐伯虎，不要枉費我們的一番心血。

sentences.english: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.
sentences.chinese: 我爲你們害怕，惟恐我在你們身上是枉費了工夫。
她的謹慎只是枉費心機。

sentences.english: But there were some who were indignantly commenting among themselves: Why has this waste of the ointment been made?
sentences.chinese: 但有幾個人惱怒著彼此說，何必這樣枉費香膏？

sentences.english: All my love, and glory I'll waste on You.
sentences.chinese: 我所有一切的愛，榮耀，都枉費在你身上。

sentences.english: I am afraid you will be futile.
'In vain, ' quoth she, 'I live, and seek in vain.
sentences.chinese: “我枉自活着，”她說，“而我又枉費心思。

sentences.english: I tried to attract his attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想要引起他的注意，卻枉費心機。

sentences.english: To depend on your memory without studying for a test is to grasp at straws.
sentences.chinese: 應付考試光靠好記性而不用功是枉費心機。

sentences.english: When the disciples saw this, they were indignant. "Why this waste?"
sentences.chinese: 門徒看見，就很不喜悅，說，何用這樣的枉費呢。

sentences.english: They tried in vain to write down the movement.
sentences.chinese: 他們試圖寫文章詆譭這個運動，可是枉費心機。

sentences.english: But when his disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?
sentences.chinese: 門徒看見，就很不喜悅，說，何用這樣的枉費呢。

sentences.english: Listening to the words to songs that you never bothered listening to before.
sentences.chinese: 聼那些你以前從不願爲此枉費工夫的歌詞。

definition: to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to worry/to be on one's mind
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
